title: Electric PE - line vs triangle vs right triangle

content.question: The figures show three different systems of point charges, all of which have positive charge. In System <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>, three point charges of charge <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Q</mi></math> are arranged along a straight line with a spacing of <math alttext="s over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>s</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>. In System <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, three point charges of charge <math alttext="2 Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>Q</mi></math> each are arranged at the corners of an equilateral triangle of side length <math alttext="s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi></math>. In System <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math>, three point charges of different charges are arranged at the corners of a right triangle, as shown in the figure. Which of the following correctly ranks the electric potential energies <math alttext="U sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub></math>, <math alttext="U sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></msub></math>, and <math alttext="U sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></msub></math> of the three systems? Take the potential energy of each system to be zero when the point charges are infinitely far from one another.
